title: Re-apply for a driving licence following a medical condition

details.description: Re-apply for a driving licence if your licence was taken away (revoked) or if you surrendered your licence following a medical condition
details.alternative_title: Re-apply for your licence if it was revoked/surrendered following a medical condition
details.body:
If your licence was taken away following a medical condition, you must re-apply to DVLA before you start driving again.

Check with your doctor that you can meet the medical standards of fitness to drive before re-applying for your licence.

Car and motorcycle licence

You need to fill in a D1 application form and the right questionnaire for your medical condition, and send them to DVLA.

Search for your medical condition to find the right questionnaire.

Order a D1 pack which has everything you need to make an application.

D1 packs are also available from Post Office branches.

Bus, coach and lorry licence

You need to fill in a D2 application form and the right questionnaire for your medical condition, and send them to DVLA.

Search for your medical condition to find the right questionnaire.

Order a D2 pack which has everything you need to make an application.

D2 packs are also available from Post Office branches.

If you’re over 45

If you’re aged 45 to 65 you only have to fill in a D4 and send it to DVLA – if you haven’t done so in the past 5 years.

From the age of 65, your licence will need to be renewed each year and your application must be accompanied by a completed D4 medical report form.

Download ‘D4 Medical examination report’ (PDF, 211KB)

Download ‘FEP1 questionnaire’ (PDF, 247KB)

Driving licences issued from 19 January 2013 will look different, but your existing licence will still be valid.

Where to send your application

Send your completed application to DVLA by fax on 0845 850 0095 or by post.
